definitions.title: n.f. ephah
definitions.body: (etym. dub., LXX. oifi etc., cf. Copt. ôipi, Thes Lag:Or. ii. 2 & cit.)—´[[א]] Nu 5:15 +; [[אֵפָה]] Ex 16:36 +; cstr. [[אֵיפַת]] Le 19:36 +;—ephah, a grain-measure.

a certain quantity of wheat, barley, etc. = ten omers ([[עׂמֶר]]) Ex 16:36 (cf. in measure of offerings Le 5:11, Le 6:13, Nu 5:15, Nu 28:5, all ´[[עֲשִׂירִית הָא]]; = 1/10 chomer ([[חׂמֶר]]) Ez Eze 45:11 (= bath, [[בַּת]], liqu. meas. q.v.) cf. Is 5:10; chiefly of offerings, v. supr. & 1Sa 1:24, Ez Eze 45:13, Eze 45:13, Eze 45:24, Eze 45:24, Eze 45:24, Eze 46:5, Eze 46:5, Eze 46:7, Eze 46:7, Eze 46:7, Eze 46:11, Eze 46:11, Eze 46:11, Eze 46:14; cf. Ju Jdg 6:19, but also of food 1Sa 17:17 cf. Ru 2:l7 & Is 5:10 supr.

receptacle or measure, holding an ephah, in proph. vision Zec 5:6, Zec 5:7, Zec 5:8, Zec 5:9, Zec 5:10; just measure [[אֵיפַת־חֶדֶק]] Le 19:36 (‖´[[מאׁזְנֵי־ח]], ´[[אַבְנֵי־ח]], ´[[הִֶין ח]]) cf. Ez Eze 45:10, Eze 45:11; [[אֵיפָה]] ´[[שׁלֵמָה וׇח]] De 25:15 (‖´[[וׇח]] ´[[אֶבֶן שׁ]]); of unjust measure [[אֵיפָה וְאֵיפָה]] De 25:14 Pr 20:10; ´[[הַקְטִין א]] Am 8:5; [[אֵיפַת רָווֹן]] Mic 6:10. (On the actual size of ephah, cf. [[בַּת]]).
